snippet: Gov. Pat Quinn used his State of the State address on Wednesday to implore legislators again to curb pensions costs that he said were “squeezing out” other vital services.
abstract: Illinois Gov Pat Quinn uses his State of the State address to implore legislators again to curb pensions costs that he says are 'squeezing out' other vital services; says state, with $96 billion in unfunded pension liabilities, is at 'critical juncture.'
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pat Quinn used his State of the State address on Wednesday to implore legislators again to curb pensions costs that he said were “squeezing out” other vital services.

headline.main: Governor of Illinois Tells Legislators Pension Costs Put State at ‘Critical Juncture’
headline.print_headline: Governor of Illinois Tells Legislators Pension Costs Put State at ‘Critical Juncture’
